business.headline: Standard not met: What Astronomer said on CEO Andy Byron's Coldplay kiss cam rowAstronomer responded to the viral video by placing CEO Andy Byron on leave, later confirming his resignation after stating that leadership standards had not been met. The company emphasised its commitment to accountability and the core values it was founded on.
India's rich are swapping gold for bitcoin. Here's WhyNow-a-days more of India's rich are putting a slice of their gold-backed wealth into shiny new digital coins like Bitcoin.

Astronomer CEO Andy Byron quits after Coldplay kiss cam scandalDataOps firm Astronomer's CEO, Andy Byron, has resigned following a scandal at a Coldplay concert which also involved the firm's HR head, Kristen Cabot. In a statement, the company announced the board of directors had accepted the resignation, stating that "the company's standard wasn't met." The New York-based unicorn company, founded in 2018, confirmed that a search for a new CEO is underway. The resignation followed a board-initiated investigation after an incident at a Coldplay event involving the CEO went viral. The board said that leaders are expected to set the standard in conduct and accountability. There has been no official update regarding any action taken against the HR head, Kristen Cabot, who is the Chief People's Officer at the company.

Andy Byron, Astronomer CEO caught in Coldplay kiss cam scandal, resignsAndy Byron resigns as CEO of AI firm Astronomer after a viral 'kiss cam' video with HR chief Kristin Cabot sparked online speculation and prompted an internal review by the company.

Career, kids and a cause: Shloka Ambani shares what keeps her goingIn a heart-to-heart on Masoom Minawala's podcast, Shloka opened up about her journey—balancing kids, career, and a cause she truly believes in.

Astronomer CEO, HR head sent on leave after Coldplay kiss cam outs 'affair'The company issued an official statement two days after the incident, announcing that its board had initiated an internal investigation.

Tata Sons forms AI 171 memorial trust, pledges Rs 1 crore to victims' familiesTata Sons has set up the AI 171 Memorial and Welfare Trust, pledging Rs 1 crore ex gratia per victim and Rs 500 crore in total, to support crash victims, families, and responders.

Sold property and want to save tax? This tax expert suggests a smarter waySelling a property can bring in a tidy profit, but it also comes with a hefty tax bill. Many turn to 54EC bonds to save tax — but tax expert Sujit Bangar says there's a smarter way.

Sensex ends over 500 points lower, Nifty below 25,000; Axis Bank falls 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 501.51 points to 81,757.73 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 143.05 points lower at 24,968.40. Most of the broader market indices also reflected the weak sentiments on Dalal Street.

2025 tech layoffs: Amazon, Microsoft, Google fuel job fears amid AI pushThe year 2025 was supposed to be a new chapter. A time when artificial intelligence promised smarter work, faster growth, and a better future. But for tens of thousands of workers across the world, it has meant sleepless nights, and uncertain futures.

Axis Bank shares tank 7% today. Should you sell or hold the stock?Axis Bank shares: The stock has been on a downward trend in recent times. It has fallen 5.77% in the last five days, 9.14% in the past one month, and 15.27% over the last year.

Reliance Retail acquires Kelvinator to expand appliance businessReliance believes this move will help it grow faster in the consumer durables sector, connect more closely with customers, and open up bigger long-term opportunities in India's changing market.

Explained: Why Wipro shares gained as much as 4% todayThe fourth-largest IT services company in India posted an 11% jump in net profit and a 0.8% rise in revenue—both slightly ahead of market expectations, according to estimates compiled by LSEG.

Stocks, FD or MF? Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta shares 3 golden rules before you investBefore you begin investing, know how saving and investing are different. Saving keeps your money handy for emergencies or short-term plans, while investing helps it grow for bigger future goals.

Sensex tumbles over 600 points: Why is stock market falling today?The 30-share BSE Sensex tumbled 644.99 points to 81,614.25 around 12:19 pm, while the NSE Nifty 50 fell 191.30 points to 24,920.15. Losses were broad-based, with most of the major sectoral indices in the red.

ITR-2 online filing live: Know who can file, new changes and other detailsThis year, the ITR-2 form has a few important changes that every taxpayer should know. You now have to report your long-term capital gains separately for periods before and after July 23, 2024, as new indexation and tax rules apply.

The ULIP trap: Inside India's most mis-sold financial productPart one of our story explores why ULIPs remain among the most mis-sold financial products in India. Sold as all-in-one solutions, they often fail to deliver on either insurance or investment.

Who is Astronomer CEO Andy Byron, caught on Coldplay's kiss camAndy Byron, the CEO of data-driven startup Astronomer was caught on the Coldplay concert's kiss cam with a colleague, and the clip has went viral online.

Startup founder calls flight travel insurance a scam, shares experienceWhat should have been a straightforward process turned into a weeks-long battle across multiple platforms and customer service calls.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 25,100; Wipro jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 199 points to 82,060.24, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 40.50 points to 25,070.95, as of 9:28 am.

Will Sensex, Nifty rally today after Wall Street closed at a record high?The US market closed at a record high as fresh data from the United States eased concerns about an economic slowdown in the world's largest economy.

Starbucks CEO ditches 1,600 km commute, buys house near workWhen Niccol was appointed as Starbucks CEO in August last year, the company agreed to a special travel plan. He was allowed to commute between California and Seattle using a corporate jet, as long as he worked from the Seattle office at least three days a week.

Walmart cuts hundreds of roles to streamline operations: ReportEarlier this year, Walmart announced about 1,500 job cuts, which hit teams in its global tech division, online order fulfilment in US stores and its advertising arm, Walmart Connect.
Sensex ends 375 points lower, Nifty below 25,200; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 375.24 points to close at 82,259.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 100.60 points to end at 25,111.45.
Dalal Street not Asia's darling anymore, says BofA surveyThe latest survey by Bank of America (BofA), shows that investor interest in Indian stock market has dropped in recent months.

How safe are India's instant loan appsFrom students low on fees to families with sudden hospital bills, many use instant loan apps for fast cash, some promise money in 10–30 minutes using just a phone and a few documents.

Sebi looks to extend tenure of derivatives contracts, says officialSebi is signalling a shift toward deeper, more stable markets by discouraging speculative short-term trades and pushing for longer-tenure contracts, amid growing retail losses and extreme derivatives dominance.

Is Thane outshining Mumbai real estate with cheaper housing?Most new homes coming up in Thane are either 1BHK or 2BHK units. About 45% of new supply from 2020 to 2025 was 2BHKs, while 42% was 1BHKs. Larger homes like 3BHKs and 4BHKs together make up only around 13% of the new supply.

Personal loan rates 2025: How much are SBI, ICICI and others charging?Many banks in India have updated their personal loan interest rates for 2025. Most banks are offering rates starting from about 9.50% per year and going up to 10.50% for some customers, depending on their credit score and repayment ability.

TCS benching policy sparks fear among employees after first cycle: ReportThe policy, introduced on June 12, limits the time employees can remain without project work to just 35 days. After this, they face the risk of losing out on promotions or even losing their jobs.

New UPI rules: What happens if payments fail now?Earlier, if someone raised a chargeback, say, when money was deducted, but they did not get what they paid for, and it got declined, the bank had to go through an extra step.

Parliament panel proposes revival of key tax relief for companies: ReportThe government is set to restore Section 80M in the new Income Tax Bill, easing dividend tax burdens for companies. The bill is likely to pass in the Monsoon Session.

Are e-commerce firms hiding your rating? New survey reveals the truthThe survey asked consumers about their experience when posting negative reviews on e-commerce and quick commerce apps. Out of 16,519 responses, only 11% said their negative reviews were "published as is."
Sensex opens flat, Nifty above 25,200; SBI shares up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 41.02 points to 82,593.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 13.30 points to 25,198.75 as of 9:30 am.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces to list today. Will it make strong market debut?The company had set a price band of Rs 407 per share for the IPO. The total issue size was Rs 582.56 crore, which included a fresh issue of 1.09 crore shares worth Rs 445 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 34 lakh shares valued at Rs 137.56 crore.

Anthem Biosciences IPO: Allotment status live. GMP, listing details hereInvestors who applied for the Anthem Biosciences IPO can check their allotment status online through two platforms: the BSE website and the website of the IPO registrar, KFin Technologies.
Sensex closes 64 points higher, Nifty above 25,200; SBI gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 63.57 points to end at 82.634.48, while the NSE Nifty50 gained just 16.25 points to close at 25,212.05.

Gurugram's luxury flats, flooded streets: Is real estate bubble about to burst?Gurugram's luxury real estate may be booming, but repeated rain-induced flooding is testing its long-term value. If basic infrastructure fails, even the city's glitziest addresses could lose their appeal.

Is gold losing its shine? Here's why fewer people are investing in the yellow metalEarlier, gold symbolised family pride and social standing, but today's youngsters often see gold jewellery as outdated and instead put their money into things they believe will grow faster than gold ever could.

Fewer slabs, simpler rules? Next GST Council meet may trigger overhaulThe upcoming GST Council meeting, likely to be held in August 2025 after the monsoon session of Parliament, could bring key reforms in the way GST is structured and collected.

entertainment.headline: Is Mohit Suri's Saiyaara copy of a Korean film? Internet thinks soMohit Suri's 'Saiyaara', featuring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, hit cinemas on Friday. Soon after its release, viewers began drawing attention to noticeable similarities with a Korean film.

Band karo: Amitabh Bachchan loses patience with paps for filming outside JalsaAmitabh Bachchan was seen scolding paparazzi outside his home, Jalsa for filming his house. Take a look at the viral video.

Amitabh Bachchan mourns dear friend and Don director Chandra Barot's deathAmitabh Bachchan paid heartfelt tribute to his director-friend, Chandra Barot. They worked together in the cult classic 'Don'.

Parineeti-Raghav leave Kapil's shoot midway after politician's mother falls illParineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha's debut appearance on Kapil Sharma's show was unexpectedly halted due to a medical emergency involving Raghav's mother. The couple reportedly had to leave the show mid-shoot to visit the hospital.

Anirudh Ravichander's Chennai concert postponed over overwhelming ticket demandSinger-composer Anirudh Ravichander postponed his Chennai concert due to overwhelming ticket demand. He was scheduled to perform on July 26 at Thiruvidanthai.

Between Kapil Sharma and Gong Yoo: Vir Das's Fool Volume debuts strong on NetflixVir Das humourously celebrated his Netflix special 'Fool Volume', debuting at Number 3 in India, sandwiched between popular shows 'The Great Indian Kapil Show' and 'Squid Game: Season 3'. He shared a fun AI image caught between Kapil Sharma and Gong Yoo.

Rajamouli, wife Rama enjoy Brad Pitt's F1 at Hyderabad's Prasads theatre. WatchFilmmaker SS Rajamouli was captured watching actor Brad Pitt's 'F1 The Movie'. Videos of him leaving the theatres went viral.

Mamata Banerjee wishes speedy recovery to brother Shah Rukh Khan after injuryWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee expressed concern for Shah Rukh Khan's injury during 'King' shoot. He is currently in the UK recovering.

Nothing brings Nick Jonas more joy than celebrating Priyanka, his new post has it allPop star Nick Jonas penned a heartfelt birthday tribute for his wife, Priyanka Chopra, accompanied by a romantic photo. The couple, who have been married since 2018, continue to serve major relationship goals.
Don director Chandra Barot dies at 86, Farhan Akhtar pays tributeVeteran filmmaker Chandra Barot died at the age of 86. He was best known for his work in Amitabh Bachchan's 'Don'.

Charli XCX marries The 1975's George Daniel in London town hall ceremonyPop sensation Charli XCX married George Daniel of The 1975 in an intimate ceremony held in London. The bride turned heads in a stylish white mini dress paired with her trademark sunglasses.

Just like that she's a teen: Mahesh Babu, Namrata wish daughter Sitara on birthdaySitara Ghattamaneni, daughter of Telugu superstar Mahesh Babu and Namrata Shirodkar, celebrated her 13th birthday surrounded by heartfelt wishes from family and fans. The teenager, already popular on social media, continues to charm the Telugu film fraternity with her growing presence and talent.

Sham Kaushal was suicidal after cancer diagnosis: Wanted to jump from third floorActor Vicky Kaushal's father, Sham Kaushal, recalled that after undergoing surgery, his doctor had warned him he might not survive. He believes it was his prayers and faith that helped him pull through.

Parag Tyagi calls Shefali Jariwala a beloved maasi in emotional postParag Tyagi continues to honour his late wife Shefali Jariwala with touching posts celebrating her loving nature and their cherished memories together. On Sunday, he shared a post remembering the best aunt that she was to her nephew and niece.

Vampire Diaries's Paul Wesley engaged to model-girlfriend Natalie KuckenburgPaul Wesley, known for his role in 'The Vampire Diaries', is engaged to model Natalie Kuckenburg. The couple shared the news privately on Instagram during a trip to Italy, where they have reportedly been visiting since 2022.

Saiyaara box office Day 2: Ahaan-Aneet's film shines brighter, nears Rs 50 croreMohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' has taken the Indian box office by storm, becoming the biggest surprise hit of the year with a Rs 48.25 crore collection in just two days. The film's success without star power or heavy promotion signals a strong comeback for romantic dramas, especially among the Gen Z audience.

Exclusive: How a bar night helped Ahaan Panday land Saiyaara, reveals Mohit SuriIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, filmmaker Mohit Suri shared the story behind casting Ahaan Panday in 'Saiyaara'. He said that an unusual test revealed the actor's true character and energy, shaping the film's lead role.

Alia Bhatt, Mahesh Babu are all love for Ahaan-Aneet's Saiyaara: Take a bowActors Alia Bhatt and Mahesh Babu showered heartfelt praise on the film 'Saiyaara', describing its lead actors as "magical stars" and commending the emotional depth of the story.

Saiyaara fans turn theatres into concert halls. Videos go viralPlanning to watch Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' this weekend? Here's how audiences are reacting to Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's big-screen debut.

general news.headline: Shashi Tharoor no longer one of us: Congress leader's jab blows rift wide openSenior Congress leader K Muraleedharan said that his party colleague Shashi Tharoor was no longer considered 'one of us.' He added that the party's national leadership would decide what action was required against the Congress MP.

Tamil Nadu girl was bitten, raped by suspect, fought him off; saved another childA 10-year-old girl, who was kidnapped and allegedly raped in Tamil Nadu on July 12, was assaulted several times by the suspect before fighting him off and saving another minor, who approached the crime spot.

Video: Mumbai man unleashes pit bull on boy inside auto, laughs as dog attacksThe dog's owner entered the auto with the pit bull, prompting all the children to flee in fear. However, the victim was unable to escape in time. What followed was extremely disturbing. Sohail first scared the boy, Hamza, with the dog and then unleashed it on him.

Injured Nitish, Arshdeep ruled out of 4th Test against EnglandIndia vs England: India's injury woes have continued ahead of the 4th Test match in Manchester. Nitish Kumar Reddy has suffered a knee injury just days ahead of the 4th Test match and has been ruled out of the game. Additionally, seamer Akash Deep is also doubtful for the game as well.
Viral video: Man eats chicken inside ISKCON restaurant in London, sparks outrageA video of a man eating fried chicken inside ISKCON's Govinda restaurant in London has gone viral on social media.

Maharashtra 'godman' beat followers with shoes, fed them urine; now on the runThe self-styled godman carried out inhumane acts — beating people with sticks, forcing them to hold shoes in their mouths, and even making them drink urine — all in the name of exorcism.

Vested interest: Minister rejects US media's 'pilot error' spin on Air India crashTargeting Western media reports suggesting pilot error, Union Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu said that the central air accident investigation agency has appealed to Western media outlets 'that may have a vested interest in the kind of articles they are trying to publish.'

Flight AI171 loss aches, yet data shows air travel the safest in IndiaThe Aircraft Accidents Investigation Bureau has underscored the safety of the Indian aviation industry and called out the international media for projecting 'unfounded facts'

The dead cry for justice in the land of hit-and-runLegendary marathoner Fauja Singh, 114, was recently killed in a hit-and-run accident. Over 30,400 people were killed in such accidents in India in 2022. But why do people flee accident spots, leaving behind the victim? Fear of being lynched, a sense of impunity and little value for lives play a role. Police also categorise accidents as hit-and-run to avoid probing them. Can India, where corruption rules, bring down hit-and-run cases?
SSVM Institutions: From Cradle to CosmosForging Futures with Foresight, Flair, and Faith

Caught on camera playing rummy in House, Maharashtra minister's 'YouTube' defenceThe video, widely circulated on social media, was shared by Nationalist Congress Party (Sharadchandra Pawar) leader Rohit Pawar, who launched a sharp attack on the minister and the government over the incident.

No WTC Final in India till 2031, confirms ICCThe ICC has confirmed England will host the World Test Championship Finals until 2031. This decision follows ECB's successful management of the previous three editions, reinforcing England's status as the tournament's home.

Why two brothers married one bride in Himachal and is it legal?In a rare instance of polyandry, two brothers from Himachal Pradesh's Hatti tribe married the same woman in a traditional ceremony known as Jodidara. The practice, rooted in preserving ancestral land and family unity, is still legally recognised in parts of the state despite its gradual decline.

Man tries to retrieve slipper from river, slips, swept away as friends watchA 20-year-old youth drowned in Seoni, MP while trying to retrieve his slipper from a river during a picnic. The tragic incident was caught on camera and his body was recovered the next day.

Admitted after fight, Tamil Nadu woman stabbed to death by husband in hospital bedOn Sunday morning, Vishruth entered the hospital, stabbed Shruthi -- who was in an unconscious state at that time -- three times and escaped, killing her. She was admitted to a government hospital after reportedly sustaining injuries following an argument with Vishruth on Saturday.

Milkiyat ki jang mein...: Judge turns poet while granting bail in property caseA judge of a Delhi court turned a poet for a while and recited his own poetry while granting bail to a man accused of illegally possessing his mother's property.

Beneath the hill, a lost world: 4,000-year-old settlement found in Karnataka's MaskiArchaeologists have discovered 4,000-year-old artefacts during an excavation near Mallikarjuna Hill and the Anjaneya Swamy Temple in Maski in Karnataka's Raichur district. The findings suggest the presence of an ancient human settlement, highlighting Maski's historical significance once again.

Mitchell Marsh to play as specialist batter, bowling remains 'offline'WI vs AUS: Mitchell Marsh said that he would play in the T20I series against the West Indies as a specialist batter. Marsh has bowled only once in limited-overs internationals since March 2024.

Zheng Qinwen takes short break from WTA Tour after elbow surgeryWorld No.6 Qinwen Zheng has taken a short break from tennis to focus on his rehab after undergoing arthroscopic surgery. She last played in the Wimbledon where she crashed out in the opening round.

Was Harbhajan Singh jealous of Ravichandran Ashwin? Spinners address popular beliefFormer India spinners Ravichandran Ashwin and Harbhajan Singh recently addressed the age-old rumour of the latter being jealous of the former during an interview.

Shubman Gill's run-making machine will start running again in Manchester: ManjrekarFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has backed Shubman Gill to bounce back to form in the fourth Test against England set to be played from July 23 at Old Trafford in Manchester.

Play, Connect, Repeat: How turfs are transforming India's sporting spiritThe artificial turf culture is on the rise in India as major cities and states have seen arenas spring up, inviting people to come in and indulge in their favourite sport. But can these turfs bring in a sporting revolution and produce stars?

Workload management is a new thing: Harbhajan ahead of crucial Manchester TestJasprit Bumrah is one of the most honest cricketers out there and his request for rest should be respected said former cricketer Harbhajan Singh. However, the spinner believes that much is made of the term workload management in international cricket.

Anshul Kamboj added to India squad as cover for injured Arshdeep SinghHaryana seamer Anshul Kamboj has been added to the India squad for the ongoing Test series against England as cover for the injured Arshdeep Singh.

IND vs PAK: Harbhajan Singh, Shikhar Dhawan among stars who pull out of WCL tieHarbhajan Singh, Shikhar Dhawan, Suresh Raina and Yusuf Pathan have withdrawn from the India-Pakistan WCL 2025 match. Their decision comes amid controversy linked to recent geopolitical tensions between the two countries.

Jones, Ecclestone help England draw level series in rain-affected gameSophie Ecclestone and Amy Jones were the stars of the show as England levelled the series against India with a thumping win in a rain-affected second ODI at Lord's on Saturday, July 19.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
